definition: to win by a surprise move

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc
variant of 出[chu1] (classifier for plays or chapters of classical novels)
odd (number)
strange/odd/weird/wonderful/surprisingly/unusually
to manufacture/to make
system/to control/to regulate/variant of 製|制[zhi4]

victory/success/to beat/to defeat/to surpass/victorious/superior to/to get the better of/better than/surpassing/superb (of vista)/beautiful (scenery)/wonderful (view)/(Taiwan pr. [sheng1]) able to bear/equal to (a task)

sentences.english: The bayonet squad made a surprise attack and wiped out the enemy's command post.
sentences.chinese: 尖刀班出奇制胜，捣毁了敌人指挥部。

sentences.english: Different strategies can be used in English advertising to draw people's attention and to win people over.
sentences.chinese: 广告往往以不同的语言策略出奇制胜。

sentences.english: He confuses his opponents with his drunken shape and defeats his opponents by surprising move.
sentences.chinese: 形醉意不醉，用醉态迷惑对手，出奇制胜。

sentences.english: Interview process, talking about good first sentence, often a surprise move.
sentences.chinese: 面试过程中，讲好第一句话，常常可以出奇制胜。

definition: to do sth when least expected (idiom); to catch sb off guard
to catch an enemy off guard with a surprise attack (idiom, from Sunzi's "The Art of War" 孫子兵法|孙子兵法[Sun1 zi3 Bing1 fa3])
pinyin: chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4

definition: see 出其不意，攻其不備|出其不意，攻其不备[chu1 qi2 bu4 yi4 , gong1 qi2 bu4 bei4]
using the weak to defeat the strong (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
to threaten the east and strike to the west (idiom)/to create a diversion
using the few to defeat the many (idiom); to win from a position of weakness
(idiom) stay clear of the enemy's main force and strike at his weak points
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); snatching victory from the jaws of defeat
to turn defeat into victory (idiom); to turn the tide
to defeat the enemy by capturing their chief (idiom)
surprise attack/raid
lit. to besiege 魏[Wei4] and rescue 趙|赵[Zhao4] (idiom)/fig. to relieve a besieged ally by attacking the home base of the besiegers
the sword moves with side stroke (modern idiom)/fig. unexpected winning move/unconventional gambit
Jian Zoupianfeng, pseudonym of prolific modern novelist
to take an alternate route (idiom)/to find an alternative/to take a different approach/to blaze a new trail
to gain the initiative by striking first (idiom); to preempt/to anticipate/preemptive
there can never be too much deception in war/in war nothing is too deceitful/all's fair in war
